intro: Lastreopsis novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea lastreopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of New Guinea and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
